response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: class FacadeItemIterator<FacadeItem> extends ForwardingIterator<Item> {    final Iterator<Item> delegate; // backing iterator    FacadeItemIterator(Iterator<Item> delegate) {        this.delegate = delegate;    }    @Override protected Iterator<Item> delegate() {        return delegate;    }    @Override    public FacadeItem next() {        return new FacadeItem(super.next());    }}
<<<explanation>>>: You can't override the next() method of a ForwardingIterator. You can only override the delegate() method.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject:I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name" and I want to get the value of that key.I tried using JSONObject.get("name") but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You need to use the getString() method to get the value of a key in a JSONObject.
